subtitle: Check with your health worker first
description: Check with your health worker first
title: Can I use traditional remedies?
content:
Created by BabyCenter

Friends and family might offer remedies or tonics or suggest you go to a traditional healer.  Maybe you used these in the past but now you are pregnant **you need to be very careful** about what you take.

When you are pregnant, and when you are breastfeeding, some remedies and tonics might harm your baby. 

A good rule is to check with your health worker before taking any remedies or medicines. She will be able to tell you which is safe for you and your growing baby.

Another thing to remember is not to use traditional medicines or herbs without asking your health worker first. Some may not be safe to use now you are pregnant. These include food or drinks, tonics, pills, oils and creams you may get from a local healer or a traditional medicine shop.
